items: Start by standing with your feet shoulder-width apart and your hands holding the barbell at shoulder height.
Take a large step forward with your right foot, keeping your back straight and your core engaged.
Bend your right knee and lower your body until your right thigh is parallel to the ground.
Push through your right heel to stand back up to the starting position.
Repeat on the other side by taking a large step forward with your left foot.
Continue alternating legs for the desired number of repetitions.
Strengthens the legs, glutes, and core muscles
Improves balance and stability
Increases flexibility in the hips and legs
Can be modified to target different muscle groups
Can be done with minimal equipment
Helps with functional movements such as walking, running, and jumping
